itemDescription: Welsh saint who settled down in Brittany (c. 485 — c. 565)

wikipedia_page.main: Samson of Dol (also Samsun; born c. late 5th century) was a Christian religious figure, who is counted among the seven founder saints of Brittany with Pol Aurelian, Tugdual or Tudwal, Brieuc, Malo, Patern (Paternus) and Corentin. Born in southern Wales, he died in Dol-de-Bretagne, a small town in north Brittany.
